alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 09 at 9:11PM MDT until April 10 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM UNTIL 8 PM MDT SUNDAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT MONDAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Ridgetop winds will strengthen tonight and combine with poor humidity recoveries to produce locally critical fire weather conditions through the overnight hours. Consequently, critical conditions will develop quickly Sunday morning in many areas. Warm, dry, windy, and unstable conditions are forecast to persist areawide through Monday, then through Tuesday east of the central mountain chain. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 8 PM MDT SUNDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...All areas below snowpack from Sunday morning through late Sunday evening. Critical fire weather will develop once again Monday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph Sunday. Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to around 50 mph Monday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Widespread poor humidity recovery tonight will fall to between 6 and 12% Sunday then to around 8 to 14 percent Monday. * IMPACTS....Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
